mods.abstract: Wall relief of Rameses II with Gods Anubis, Horus, and Thoth, Temple of Seti I at Abydos (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); cartouche of Rameses II identifies figure of pharaoh wearing khepresh anointed by three gods (middle register), nemes crowned kneeling figures facing left present various offerings between bands of hieroglyphs (lower register); "Beato 46 334 abydos Purification de Seti" in pencil on back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

mods.note: Gift of the Friends of Egyptology, McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture, The University of Tennessee
